NSMutableDictionary(KeyPaths) Class Reference

NSMutableDictionary can read values from nested dictionaries with -[NSObject valueForKeyPath:], but not set such values.  This category adds the missing setValue:forKeyPath: method, and methods to mutate arrays located down key paths.  Each method also has a companion which takes a "key path array", which is a an array of string keys, instead of a key path, which is an equivalent dot-separated string. (void) - setValue:forKeyPath:
 Sets a value for the given keyPath in the receiver, creating dictionaries as needed if they do not exist, and inserting values into existing dictionaries if they do exist.
(void) - setValue:forKeyPathArray:
(id) - valueForKeyPathArray:
 A wrapper around -valueForKeyPath: which changes the parameter to be a key path array, instead of a dot-separated string of keys.

Detailed Description

NSMutableDictionary can read values from nested dictionaries with -[NSObject valueForKeyPath:], but not set such values.  This category adds the missing setValue:forKeyPath: method, and methods to mutate arrays located down key paths.  Each method also has a companion which takes a "key path array", which is a an array of string keys, instead of a key path, which is an equivalent dot-separated string.

This class is a clone of NSUserDefaults (KeyPaths).

Member Function Documentation

- (void) setValue: (id)  value
forKeyPath: (NSString *)  keyPath 

Sets a value for the given keyPath in the receiver, creating dictionaries as needed if they do not exist, and inserting values into existing dictionaries if they do exist.

The opposite method, -valueForKeyPath:, is provided by NSObject and works as expected.

Parameters:
value 
keyPath
